Package org.dellroad.stuff.io

Class BOMReader

java.lang.Object
java.io.Reader
org.dellroad.stuff.io.BOMReader
All Implemented Interfaces:
Closeable, AutoCloseable, Readable
public class BOMReader extends Reader
A Reader that wraps an InputStream, detects and strips the byte order mark, and then converts bytes into characters accordingly.

If no byte order mark is found, the input is implicitly assumed to be in some default character encoding.

The default character encoding and the action to take on malformed input are configurable.

See Also:
  • Byte order mark

  • Constructor Details

    • BOMReader

      public BOMReader(InputStream input)
      Constructor.

      Equivalent to BOMReader(input, CodingErrorAction.REPORT, Charset.defaultCharset()).

      Parameters:
      input - data input
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if input is null

    • BOMReader

      public BOMReader(InputStream input, CodingErrorAction errorAction, Charset defaultCharset)
      Primary constructor.

      The errorAction configures the behavior when malformed input is encountered; in the case of CodingErrorAction.REPORT, a MalformedInputException exception is thrown.

      Parameters:
      input - data input
      errorAction - what to do about malformed input
      defaultCharset - character encoding to use if no BOM is found
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if any parameter is null

  • Method Details

    • getBOM

      public BOM getBOM() throws IOException
      Get the BOM found at the beginning of the input.

      If no input has been read yet, this method will trigger the reading of the first few bytes.

      Returns:
      the BOM that was detected, or null if no supported BOM was found
      Throws:
      IOException

    • getCharset

      public Charset getCharset() throws IOException
      Get the actual character encoding used.

      If no input has been read yet, this method will trigger the reading of the first few bytes.

      Returns:
      the character encoding chosen to decode the data, never null
      Throws:
      IOException
